geo.title: Geographical overview of the city of Massawa
geo.text: Massawa is the second most important city and the main port in Eritrea...

timeline.item4: 1557: The Islamic Ottoman Eyalet of Abyssinia
timeline.description: The historic city of Massawa is located on the island of Baida

about.title: From Exile to Homecoming: Rediscovering Massawa's Urban Heritage
about.intro: An Eritrean civil initiative that seeks to document and protect the urban heritage of Massawa
about.goalText: The inscription of the ancient city of Massawa on the UNESCO World Heritage List.
about.stagesTitle: Stages and objectives of the initiative
about.stage1: Launching the idea of the initiative in 2020 in Stockholm.
about.stage2: A specialized founding working group has been formed.
about.stage3: Formation of the Old City working body is ongoing.
about.stage4: The initiative was registered as an NGO in Norway in 2023.
about.firstStageText1: Identifying the boundary of the area to be protected.
about.firstStageText2: Determining a preliminary list of the most important historical buildings.

mailing.title: Mailing List Sign up
mailing.desc1: The initiative is open to ideas and further initiatives to spread out the goals of the initiative, to the whole Eritrean diaspora. Therefore, we encourage all Eritreans to get on board with us to achieve our goals. The first step is to be with us on our mailing list.
mailing.desc2: Get news about the initiative sent to your own box and leave your message by suggestions you have for improvement

main.title: Documenting History: The Journey of Protecting Massawa's Architectural Treasures
main.intro1: As a stage of implementing the initiative, one of the first stages is preparing studies to collect and document information about the city. Three studies were prepared, after reviewing previous studies.
main.study1: A Preliminary Study and Plan to Preserve and Restore the Old city of Massawa by UNESCO 1998
main.study2: Study and Master plan for the old city of Massawa presented by Qatari Diar Real Estate Company in 2009

seminars.title: Seminars
seminars.subtitle: Holding seminars and spreading awareness of the importance of preserving the city's heritage.
seminars.description: Two seminars were held during the years 2020–2021

publications.title: Publication of studies about the ancient city of Massawa
publications.description: The initiative is open to publish some of their own studies in the coming future.

urban.conventionsTitle: International conventions related to Urban Heritage
urban.conventionsText: The Convention of Heritage 1972: It is one of the most important tools to protect and maintain World Cultural Heritage. Most important organization in this field: UNESCO, World Heritage Centre (WHC), and ICOMOS.
urban.methodologyTitle: Urban heritage restoration Methodology and Tools
urban.methodologyDescription: The methodology and electronic toolkit developed by ArcHerNet will be used.
urban.toolkitIntro: This toolkit covers four main topics:
urban.toolkitList: Documentation, Damage Assessment, Legal framework terms, Planning.
urban.eritreaText: Eritrea has a diverse urban heritage...
urban.classificationTitle: Classification of the urban heritage in Eritrea chronologically:

classification.ancient: Ancient Era: Adulis, Kohito, Matarah, Debarwa.
classification.middle: Middle Ages: Islamic civilization in Massawa and Dahlak.

urban.classificationText: Ancient heritage is underground and requires archaeological research...
urban.asmaraTitle: Asmara... on the World Heritage List
urban.asmaraText: Asmara was registered on the UNESCO World Heritage List in 2017.
urban.massawaOverviewTitle: An overview of the urban history of the ancient city of Massawa
urban.divisionTitle: The old city covers 2.50 km² with 8,000–9,000 residents in 1975.
urban.divisionIntroTitle: Division of the master plan of the old city
urban.divisionText: The city was planned according to Islamic medieval structures.
urban.divisionSections: The city is divided into four sections:
urban.divisionList: Downtown, North Sea Side, Market areas, Eastern and Southern neighborhoods.
urban.briefTitle: Brief about the urban heritage of Massawa
urban.architectureText: The architectural style reflects multiple eras.
urban.buildingTypes: Historical buildings include mosques, markets, government buildings, banks, and hotels.
